item.title: Missing 20mph sign on Caspian Way, 14th October
item.description:
Can the council review the road traffic signs around the new playground on the junction of Caspian Way, Church Hollow and Vineyard Way RM19 1UD. Facing towards Caspian Way the 20mph speed restriction sign on the pole is missing. The 20mph sign on the other side of the road is covered up by bushes. Facing towards the playground, from Caspian Way and from Church Lane there are no speed restriction signs at all suggesting it is still a 30 mph speed limit however the playground is now used daily and one gate opens directly into the highway

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Caspian Way
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 156 W End Ln, London NW6 1SD, 14th October
item.description:
The pavement outside of the development at 156 that paid Camden in the vicinity of £25 million pounds is unfit for purpose. It is uneven and cracked. The area that was once the driveway to Travis Perkins is routinely impassable by pedestrians. When it is not being used as a parking lot for deliveries, it is a giant puddle. It is not acceptable to ignore the public highway, but especially galling after a huge payout and the developer has taken ZERO responsibility for restoring damage done by their equipment to the public pavement, nor built anything of benefit to the public where they have changed the layout of the roadway and footpath.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West End Lane, West Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
